channel.title: lucene on Mark Needham
channel.description: Recent content in lucene on Mark Needham

item.title: neo4j/cypher/Lucene: Dealing with special characters
item.description: CREATE ({name: "-one"}) CREATE ({name: "-two"}) CREATE ({name: "-three"}) CREATE ({name: "four"}) START p = node:node_auto_index("name:-*") RETURN p; ==> RuntimeException: org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException: Cannot parse 'name:-*': Encountered " "-" "- "" at line 1, column 5. ==> Was expecting one of: ==> <BAREOPER> ... ==> "(" ... ==> "*" ... ==> <QUOTED> ... ==> <TERM> ... ==> <PREFIXTERM> ... ==> <WILDTERM> ... ==> "[" ... ==> "{" ... ==> <NUMBER> ... ==> START p = node:node_auto_index("name:\-*") RETURN p; ==> SyntaxException: invalid escape sequence ==> ==> Think we should have better error message here?

item.title: neo4j/cypher: Playing around with time
item.description: > DateTime.now.strftime("%H%M") => "2200" START game=node:times('time:*') RETURN game.time, COUNT(game) ORDER BY game.time +-------------------------+ | game.time | COUNT(game) | +-------------------------+ | 1245 | 21 | | 1330 | 21 | | 1500 | 163 | | 1600 | 29 | | 1730 | 22 | | 1945 | 21 | | 2000 | 19 | +-------------------------+ 7 rows START game=node:matches('match_id:*') RETURN game.time, COUNT(game) ORDER BY game.time START game=node:times('time:[1600 TO 2000]') RETURN game.

item.title: neography/neo4j/Lucene: Getting a list of all the nodes indexed
item.description: I’ve been playing around with neo4j using the neographygem to create a graph of all the people in ThoughtWorks and the connections between them based on working with each other. I created a UI where you could type in the names of two people and see when they’ve worked together or the path between the shortest path between them if they haven’t. I thought it would be cool to have auto complete functionality when typing in a name but I couldn’t figure out how to partially query the index of people’s names that I’d created.
